entries.meaning: (UK, slang, Southern England, Northern Ireland) Friend, acquaintance.
examples: Fancy a pint, my old mucker?

entries.meaning: (slang, British Army) A comrade; a friendly, low-ranking soldier in the same situation.
examples: Go and talk to your mucker!

entries.meaning: A person who removes muck (waste, debris, broken rock, etc.), especially from a mine, construction site, or stable.
(archaic, derogatory) A low or vulgar labourer.

verbs.description: mucker (third-person singular simple present muckers, present participle muckering, simple past and past participle muckered)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To scrape together (money, etc.) by mean labour or shifts.
